newsitem.title: POLAND: WBK, AIB TO SET UP MUTUAL FUNDS.
newsitem.headline: WBK, AIB TO SET UP MUTUAL FUNDS.

text.p: Poland's Wielkopolski Bank Kredytowy SA and Allied Irish Banks Plc signed on Wednesday a letter of intent on setting up mutual investment funds and an asset management company in Poland, WBK said in a statement.

"The aim of WBK and AIB is to create a joint venture in the sphere of professional investment management in which the group of mutual trust funds and the asset management firm will play an important role," the statement said.
It said the company running the group of funds would be fully owned by the asset management company, in turn equally owned by WBK and AIB.

"The company running the funds will have at least the capital required by the Polish Securities Committee for one fund. It will be increasd for each additional fund," it said. AIB has 36.3 percent of WBK. -- Warsaw Newsroom +48 22 653 9700
